title.narrative: Amplifying Voices of Women with Disabilities in Kenya

description.narrative: 1. To increase visibility and capacities of disabled persons organizations (DPOs) and women with disabilities to effectively represent and advocate for their rights at national and county levels. 2. To work with authorities at all levels to ensure inclusion of rights of women and girls with disabilities in policy framework development and implementation.

LIGHT FOR THE WORLD specifically takes care of: • Give support tot he building of M&E framework o IATI training o Support set up of monitoring framework • Support the drafting of training materials for: o Peer trainers (master trainers) o DPOs o WwDs being trained o County level officials and women rights organisations o Contributing Disability inclusion methodology, inclusive facilitation techniques, disability rights awareness • Contribute a trainer to the pool of trainers for master training • Capacity assessments: disability inclusion part, 5C-model o For DPOs o Women Rights Organisations (including barriers analysis) o Training needs assessment: contribute • Support the baseline assessment content and mid-term and final evaluations • Policy analysis support and formulation where needed

The final beneficiaries of the actions resulting from this projects are families and communities of women and girls with disabilities, but also boys and men with disabilities, living in the targeted counties and beyond.
The overall goal of this intervention is to contribute to improved human rights situations of women with disabilities in Kenya.
